page.title: 10Doodle Bug on Dedworth.
page.content: On a brilliantly, sunny, midsummer's day in{1943}my father took me for a bicycle ride to see some friends. I was promised a ride on the swings as I cuddled up behind my Dad on the{comfy {seat on the back of his bicycle.}We passed the milkman with his horse and float and a few cyclists but no cars. On our journey we looked out across fields and the first of the many farms there were at Dedworth. The smell of new mown hay, cows, horses and the heady perfume of roses filled the air. Dad pedalled along with an occasional question as to whether I was comfortable and then suddenly the {idyllic peace was shattered}with an awful{boomp-boomp-boomp}noise that came from overhead, yet seemed to echo from inside you. I glanced upwards and saw a long cigar-shaped black object with a fin at the back of it.
